contentrichtext.text: '''Zion Cohen''' ({{lang-he|ציון כהן}}, born March 7, 1983) is an [[Israeli Jews|Israeli]] [[football (soccer)]] [[striker]] who last played for [[Maccabi Tel Aviv F.C.|Maccabi Tel-Aviv]].<ref>{{Cite web|publisher=One|title=ציון כהן|url=http://www.one.co.il/c.aspx?target=%2Fsitectr2%2Easp%3FCategoryID%3D3%26TableID%3D696%26TeamID%3D13%26PlayerID%3D31033%26Season%5FID%3D02%2D03%26nocache%3D1|accessdate=2009-04-03}}</ref> The 22 year-old striker came from [[Hapoel Ashkelon]] scored 15 goals in [[Ashkelon]] and promoted the team together with [[Carlos Chacana]] to the second league. In July 2005, Cohen was found to have a [[Genetics|genetic]] [[spleen]] problem, which caused him to resign from soccer. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Cohen, Zion | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Israeli footballer | DATE OF BIRTH = March 7, 1983 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Cohen, Zion}} [[Category:1983 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Israeli Jews]] [[Category:Jewish footballers]] [[Category:Israeli footballers]] [[Category:Hapoel Ashkelon F.C. players]] [[Category:Maccabi Tel Aviv F.C. players]] [[Category:Hapoel Ironi Rishon LeZion F.C. players]] {{Israel-footy-bio-stub}}
